programme.title: Dirty Talk: When Daytime Talk Shows Ruled TV
programme.desc: A look back at the rise, fall and lasting impact of the most sensational era in TV talk show history. By exploring the psychological forces that shaped the talk TV genre, the series reveals how these shows transformed from trusted confessional spaces into lightning rods of controversy, leaving a lasting impact on culture, media and the people caught in the chaos.

programme.desc: In Lexington, Kentucky, a newly wed wife parties like there's no tomorrow, until a body is dumped on a golf course; in Brisbane, Australia, there are fears for the safety of a missing wife.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Poughkeepsie, New York, a police officer discovers his wife is cheating on him, leading to a deadly encounter; in Orlando, Florida, a woman gets herself a boy toy with fatal results.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Pleasant Grove, Utah, a former beauty queen goes under the knife to look sexier for her husband, but the romance quickly comes to a horrifying end.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Alpena, Michigan, a neighborhood recluse winds up dead after developing a special bond with a much younger cleaner who enjoys spending his money.

programme.title: Deep Undercover
programme.desc: FBI agent Herman Groman infiltrates a group of crooked cops in Cleveland, Ohio, by setting up an illegal gambling operation to snare the cops who offer him protection, but the police are trained to detect deception.

programme.title: Deep Undercover
programme.desc: Agent Jim Sweeting sails the Caribbean to break the Cayman cartel drug operation; U.S. Customs supervisor Bill Gately discovers the Mexican banking system is funding South American cartels; DEA agent Louis Diaz joins the Medellin cartel.

programme.title: Deep Undercover
programme.desc: FBI agent Jim Nice partners with the Akron Police to target the Kaika Klan Outlaws, a black street gang that's terrorizing the city, but Jim is white, and this won't be a cake walk.

programme.title: Deep Undercover
programme.desc: When Independence, Missouri cop Steve Cook stumbles upon a meth lab, an undercover operation is launched with Steve as the point man; problem is, Independence is a small town and Steve gets made as a cop.

In its history, the winner has been on the team who lost the championship title. This year we followed four of the best goal scorers in the world through their quest to be the first player to win the Championship Series trophy and the Golden Stick Award.

programme.title: My Darling Clementine
programme.desc: In the middle of a long cattle drive, Wyatt Earp (Henry Fonda) and his brothers stop off for a night in the town of Tombstone. The next morning they find their cattle stolen, and one of the brothers is dead. Earp suspects the Clanton family, owners of the O.K. Corral, but wants his revenge to be legal. He becomes sheriff of Tombstone and forges a rough peace with an alcoholic gambler, Doc Holiday (Victor Mature). Earp also takes a liking to Holiday's former girlfriend, Clementine (Cathy Downs).

programme.title: The Last Wagon
programme.desc: Comanche Todd (Richard Widmark), a white man living with an Indian tribe, is captured by Sheriff Bull Harper (George Mathews) following the murder of the sheriff's three brothers. Heading back to town, the wagon train in which the vicious sheriff and his abused prisoner are traveling is attacked by a vengeful Apache tribe whose women and children have been killed by a band of white men. After the slaughter, Todd must bring the survivors, including the beautiful Jenny (Felicia Farr), to safety.

programme.title: These Thousand Hills
programme.desc: Albert "Lat" Evans (Don Murray) is a cowboy who dreams of becoming rich and successful. He becomes friendly with ranch hand Tom, and the two hunt wolves. After this ends badly, Lat borrows money from Callie (Lee Remick), a local woman who has feelings for him. Gradually, Lat becomes a successful rancher, ultimately forsaking Callie and Tom to marry Joyce, a banker's daughter. As Lat moves into politics, he must decide whether or not to ally himself with the devious Jehu (Richard Egan).

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: A clever safe cracker uses Pat's mail-order telescope to get the information he needs to commit his crimes.

programme.title: Tombstone

programme.title: The Return of Jesse James

programme.title: The Burning Hills
programme.desc: Cattle rancher Trace Jordan (Tab Hunter) discovers the dead body of his brother and seeks out Joe Sutton (Ray Teal), the cattle baron he knows killed him. Jordan kills Sutton in an act of self-defense during a shoot-out, but is also wounded and flees. He attempts to escape as Sutton's henchmen pursue him, and is soon joined by a half-Mexican woman named Maria (Natalie Wood), whose father had also been killed by Sutton. Eventually Sutton's men find them, and a confrontation occurs.

programme.title: The Naked Hills
programme.desc: An Indiana farmer's relentless pursuit of gold in California leads him on a tumultuous journey, testing his relationships and values.

programme.title: McLintock!
programme.desc: A cattle baron with the diplomatic savvy to keep peace between dueling power brokers in town can’t seem to get his wife and daughter under control.

programme.title: Open Range
programme.desc: Kevin Costner directed and stars in this Western about four peaceful cattle ranchers who get pushed to the edge of reason by a despicable land baron.

programme.title: Devil's Canyon
programme.desc: Abby (Virginia Mayo) runs with a brutal group of robbers in the Arizona Territory, but when she learns that members of her gang are targeting Billy (Dale Robertson), an old acquaintance, she tips him off. Billy kills the would-be assailants and is sent to prison, where he is incarcerated with Jessie (Stephen McNally), who is both the brother of the men Billy killed and Abby's lover. When Abby also gets locked up, her allegiance to the two rivals makes for an explosive situation.

programme.title: Westbound
programme.desc: A former Union officer, John Hayes (Randolph Scott) now manages a stagecoach company. However, Clay Putnam (Andrew Duggan), a businessman still loyal to the South, is intent on robbing the coaches operated by Hayes, which transport gold to the North from California. Hoping to heist the treasure as a way to revive the Confederacy, Putnam also has a grudge against Hayes, since his wife, Norma (Virginia Mayo), was once involved with the handsome Union soldier.

programme.desc: Four toughs intent on ransacking a town find their plans thwarted by a one-armed Civil War hero and his brutish pal.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho are after a thief who stole $25,000 in bonds from a friend of theirs. They soon begin to suspect that a young woman who is a cook in a hotel is actually the thief's partner.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: After the Sam Bass gang steals sixty thousand dollars of gold from a train on which Frankie rides, Frankie acts as a waitress romantically interested in captured henchman Hayes.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Frankie head to Coffeyville in 1892 when they hear that the Dalton brothers and their gang are planning something big. They arrive to thwart the double bank robbery.

programme.desc: A gang of bandits kidnaps Claire, a sheriff's fiancée, during a stagecoach robbery, and Bat goes after the outlaws in place of the injured sheriff.

programme.desc: A boy magician, a boozy hero and a furry - something team up to save a kingdom.

programme.title: RiffTrax: Abraxas, Guardian of the Universe
programme.desc: An intergalactic cop pursues a corrupt former partner; comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: While in the process of adopting a five-week-old baby, a mother takes him to work with her. While there, the baby inexplicably obtains a skull fracture while unsupervised.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A healthy 53-year-old woman is found dead in bed. After performing an autopsy and taking blood and tissue samples, Dr. G cannot find the cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police discover the dead body of Andrew Hopper clutching a syringe and covered with blood. The body is in Dr. G's hands, as are the clues to solving the case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: During her career as a medical examiner, Dr. G has autopsied thousands of murder victims. In this episode, Dr. G shares her most memorable case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Melissa Riobe's life is ruled by her addiction to drugs. Now, the 42-year-old woman has learned how to buy powerful prescription drugs online without a doctor's note.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Manny Alvarez mysteriously crashes his car into a fence. He dies en route to the hospital, leaving behind a wife and son. It is up to Dr. G to find out what cut this young man's life short.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A healthy 53-year-old woman is found dead in bed. After performing an autopsy and taking blood and tissue samples, Dr. G cannot find the cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A cabdriver develops chest pains and seizures; a hotel manager is found dead on the steps of his apartment.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A quadriplegic woman loved by her community is found dead in an Orlando park 150ft from her motorized wheelchair. Children find her lifeless body face down in the sand.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When Dr. G receives Lea Conrad's body, she suspects the woman may have died from an antihistamine overdose. Then, Dr. G learns that Lea was being treated for lupus.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Teenagers stumble across a horrifying car fire on the side of a desolate stretch of roadway. When the police arrive, they pull severely burned human remains from the driver's seat.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It's a late night and a Vietnam veteran with a history of mental illness is drunk and stumbling through an apartment complex. When the police arrive, he pulls a gun and shoots himself in the head.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An infant and his two-year-old sister are found dead in a house shared by two families. At first, they are believed to have died from either carbon monoxide poisoning or cold medicine overdoses.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must figure out if a decomposed body is that of a local missing woman and if she was murdered.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A diabetic man dies after a night out. Meanwhile, an elderly man's decomposing body is found in his son's home. Dr. G realizes that finding the causes of death will be anything but straight-forward.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: After a brief illness, 34-year old Claire Jackson dies suddenly in the hospital from massive liver failure and winds up in Dr. G's morgue.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It's an early Sunday morning when a local resident decides to take a short-cut through the church parking lot. Walking past a lone car, the resident can't believe his eyes.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Paramedics respond to a mother in distress: one of her infant twin girls hasn't woken up. By the time help arrives, it's too late. But there is no apparent cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A retired military officer is found dead in his own backyard during a freak ice storm in San Antonio, Texas.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Jeffrey Ortiz, a mentally challenged man with the mental capacity of a nine-year-old, is making himself a sandwich when he inexplicably falls, striking his head on the kitchen counter.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A decomposing body is found in a pond and a tent is found nearby. Dr. G performs the autopsy in the morgue but finds few clues other than fingerprints and mouthwash in the stomach.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police discover the dead body of Andrew Hopper clutching a syringe and covered with blood. The body is in Dr. G's hands, as are the clues to solving the case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Jerra Kirby, who's visiting family in Orlando, has suddenly passed out at a theme park wave pool and the paramedics are trying desperately to revive her.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Ricky Hawthorne, a middle-aged man with a history of AIDS, arrives at his local hospital complaining of chest pains. Doctors perform extensive tests on him but find nothing wrong and release him.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Both natural disease and sport's injury are likely suspects in Eric Brody's death. But then Dr. G learns that he was treated with antibiotics for a spider bite prior to his death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An 82-year-old woman appears to have committed suicide by overdosing on painkillers, but Dr. G finds evidence that suggests that she may have died of a heart attack.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A man is found dead in a motel room due to multiple shotgun wounds. Dr. G proves the scene isn't what it seems.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: On a Texas highway, a fire is discovered having burnt three bodies beyond recognition. Dr. G finds bullets in the bodies and determines that they were all shot before being set on fire.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G reviews a woman's medical records and learns that that she suffered from an auto-immune disease called lupus, which might have something to do with her death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Chris Schaffer has not been seen or heard from in five days. Finally, his friends find him dead and decomposed in the driver's seat of his van.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for his spring display and tackles slippery paths, Carol Klein visits a collection of Michaelmas daisies and we visit a veg grower with a show-stopping Halloween pumpkin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team focus their attention on the loss of wildflower habitats in the UK and the part that gardeners can play in averting the resulting loss of wildlife. Adam Frost is in Lincolnshire to find out how crucial meadows are to supporting an ecosystem.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the days get shorter, it is a busy time in the garden. Monty Don cracks on with his seasonal tasks at Longmeadow, giving hints and tips along the way. Carol Klein visits first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for the very last time.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn gathers momentum, it's time to start putting the garden to bed for winter. Monty Don has some timely advice on what to do. Carol Klein meets a nurseryman in Herefordshire and together they indulge in the beauty of the Japanese maple.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his loofahs, plants tulip bulbs in pots, gives a masterclass in making leafmould and reflects on the gardening year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: We find out how Rachel de Thame got on over the past year as she attempted to grow her own cut flowers, and if you're still in a quandary about what to grow in your winter pots this year, Monty Don may well have the answer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty is planting bulbs in pots and around the garden for an explosion of spring colour. Carol Klein travels to Yorkshire where she takes a close look at the enormous colour range and form of a late season perennial, the salvia. Mark Lane is in Oxfordshire looking at how ornamental grasses can be used in planting design to create exciting combinations.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's in the jewel garden showing which plants need protection from the elements now and which ones can be left until after the first frosts. He also plants out berried shrubs to help feed wildlife in the winter, harvests pumpkins and shows how to make use of fallen autumnal leaves.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty creates colourful planting schemes with trailing plants. He also plants out cabbages in the vegetable garden and shares a clever tip for dealing with spent tulips. Toby Buckland revels in the displays of roses at Mount Ephraim Gardens in Kent.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Featuring Ramona Jones, who was diagnosed with autism in her twenties and discovered how she can find her true identity when she's in the garden. Meanwhile, Monty makes some changes to his pots in the Jewel Garden, harvests gooseberries and plants out squash.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team are Birmingham-bound for the annual Gardeners' World Live event. Monty Don, Arit Anderson, Adam Frost, Sue Kent, Carol Klein, Joe Swift, Rachel de Thame and Frances Tophill present the best the gardening world has to offer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With summertime at its peak, Adam plans to extend the season with plants for evening scent and shares the results of his wild meadow turf experiment. In North Yorkshire, Nick Bailey discovers the range of floral beauty of Cornus kousa.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives a masterclass on rambling, climbing and shrub roses. He also plants out tender annuals in the jewel garden, and with hot, dry summer days ahead, shares tips for water saving and harvesting.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.desc: Monty harvests his loofahs, plants tulip bulbs in pots, gives a masterclass in making leafmould and reflects on the gardening year.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We join Denny McMahan on this episode at the legendary Thumbtack Ranch in South Texas. Denny was nominated by his wife for Bucks for the Brave program hosted by Trinity Oaks. After dedicating his life to service in the US Army and law enforcement, he now continues the mission by teaching at the police academy. Denny is a true hero in his community - someone who sacrifices his time, his well being, and his life in service to others, never asking for anything in return.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt sits down with Auburn University professor Dr. Steve Ditchkoff to tackle one of the most debated topics in deer management: cull bucks. Is there real science behind the idea of removing “inferior” bucks to improve herd genetics, or is it more myth than management?

programme.title: Winchester Life

We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Returning to Venice, Louisiana for the first time in nearly a decade, Rush reconnects with longtime friends Eric and Monique Newman of Journey South Outfitters for an unforgettable inshore fishing adventure in the heart of the Mississippi River Delta. With reports of massive schools of redfish cruising the beaches, Monique (“Moe”) must decide whether to trust the intel and make a bold run down the coast—or rely on her own instincts built from years on the water. The mission is simple: put Rush on a true bull redfish and see if he has what it takes to earn a spot in her coveted “Over 40-Inch Club.” This trip highlights why Venice, Louisiana is considered one of the premier inshore fisheries in the country—and why having the right guide makes all the difference. Target Species: Bull Redfish. Location: Venice, Louisiana – Mississippi Delta. Outfitter: Journey South Outfitters.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: For Ali and Rush, one of the best aspects of fishing is being able to share experiences on the water with interesting people. On this episode we invite luxury watch enthusiast Eric Rivera - AKA "Watch Eric" to the Florida Keys to target Permit and Amberjack in the Gulf.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: YOU WON'T BELIEVE WHAT THESE FISH DO!! Dr. Mike Larkin is back! Join us for another exciting dive into the mysterious world of fish and learn some of the most shocking fish facts mother nature has to offer.This week, Dr. Larkin takes us on another exploration of the ocean's hidden wonders, unraveling fascinating insights into fish biology. From species that change gender to surprising revelations about their arterial systems, Dr. Larkin's expertise continues to shed light on these underwater marvels.For those who've followed Dr. Larkin's previous appearances, you already know how much you will get from this interview. And if you're new here, welcome aboard for an underwater adventure that will change the way you think about our finned friends.Don't forget to like, subscribe, and share this mind-blowing episode with fellow fish enthusiasts. Let's plunge into the depths of knowledge together!

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: From fuzzy velvet to hardened bone, antlers are more than headgear—they're nature’s calendar. In this episode of Deer & Deer Hunting, we explore the fascinating stages of whitetail antler development, what they reveal about a buck’s age and health, and how understanding this process can help you become a better hunter. Join us as we break down the biology, bust myths, and show real examples from the field.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Can the everyday landowner really manage their property well enough to hold and retain mature bucks year after year? From habitat improvements and food plots to pressure control and property layout, discover what truly influences a buck’s decision to stay—or stray.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: In this in-depth episode of Deer & Deer Hunting TV, the team explores what it truly takes to implement an advanced food plot strategy. We go beyond the basics, walking viewers through soil science, crop rotation, plot placement, and how to integrate food plots into a larger habitat management plan.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Whether you're hunting 10 acres or 1,000, how you handle boundaries, buck movement, and communication with neighboring hunters can make or break your season. The team shares real-world scenarios and proven strategies to foster cooperation, avoid conflict, and build relationships that lead to better deer hunting for everyone.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Everyone knows Colorado for its epic mountains and fresh powder. But on this episode of DIRT, we’re digging into the unexpected side of the state (UFO rumors and all). Whether surfing infinite river waves, cultivating perfect carrot seeds, or fly fishing in downtown Denver’s shadow—geeky passions run high. Follow along as we gather ingredients for a farm to table final feast equal parts foraged, free-range, and free-thinking.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: They say you come to New Zealand as a stranger, but leave as family. In this episode of DIRT, the crew goes full circle—meeting Muttonbird chefs Emma and George on the South Island before hopping up to Raglan and working their way back down. Water skiing next to snow-capped mountains, cooking in hot springs the Māori way, and stargazing at Wairarapa Dark Sky Reserve are all on the itinerary. But it’s the final “Feed” done Kiwi-style that makes one thing clear—in this unique and stunning land, nobody’s a stranger for long.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: Meet Luke DiTella—once a pro surfer, now the founder of Frank August whiskey, and an all-around Renaissance man. Whether it's barrels at a Jersey beach break or barrels of aged whiskey, Luke knows how to turn life into an art form. In this episode of Huckberry Homes, we take a deep dive into Luke’s world at his coastal haven in Monmouth Beach, New Jersey. It’s a place where the salty sea air meets the rich aroma of aged whiskey—a home that’s as rugged yet refined as the man himself. Luke opens his doors to share tales of surfing glory, entrepreneurial grit, and the beautiful chaos of fatherhood (spoiler: they don't care about your design aesthetic).

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchester’s best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Chef Jean-Paul Bourgeois and the crew are back at it for season 3 of duck camp dinners. With a historically dry year in Louisiana, the team dodges marsh fires, hunts alligators, and prepares for the opening day of teal season.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Follow the DCD crew as they head North to hunt with duck call maker Brad Eldrige. Despite tough hunting conditions brought on by a historic drought in Louisiana, the crew is able to knock down a “Tensas Limit” of wood ducks, mallards, honkers, and squirrels.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: On this weeks episode of Hunting Land Man, Slade and his daughter Asa take on the turkey woods together for the first time. As this is Asa's first time turkey hunting some quick pre hunt preparations are in order. Slade also was able to sit down with a good friend and registered forester to talk fire and the benefits of fire in land management. The next day, Asa and Slade were able to connect with a thundering tom as Asa punched her first ever turkey tag!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade goes over what he’s doing at his home property to create summer food plots for deer, and gives tips to those looking to do the same. On the final hunt for the 2024 season, Lori gets a big Wilkinson County gobbler.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his son take on the turkey woods for an afternoon hunt. Although the woods remained quiet, a tom soon snuck out of the woods and on the end of Bentley's barrel! After that Slade was able to help a client of his harvest his first turkey! And boy was it an action packed hunt! Jakes, hens, and tons of gobbles, This hunt is spectacular! Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: On this episode of Hunting Land Man, Slade, Ryan and Bearcub take on the midwest! After some tough hunting, the group is able to make a move to get in position on a BIG midwestern gobbler! Bearcub was able to harvest him after working the bird for almost 45 minutes! Slade and Ryan also do some Pre-Deer season work, and establish where the fall food-plots will be!

programme.title: HUnting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his brother Tai take us around a new investment property - a 55 acre tract in Wilkinson County, MS and go over what it took to take an undesirable raw tract, to a place with multiple offers on the first day it was put on the market.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: The start of another Season of SJTV! We kick things off by heading to Trappers Landing Lodge in Northern Minnesota for some early ice panfish action!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Ice fishing Crappies at night with Freedom Baitz Bonita Minnow!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Targeting mid-winter walleyes with the new Tungsten Buck-Shot Spoon from Northland!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Locate and catch more suspended crappies during mid-winter conditions.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Today, Capt. Danny is joined by Capt. Jake Bates as the two fish Jake’s local waters of North Florida. Redfish is the targeted species, but the tide doesn’t wait on anyone around these parts…

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: Capt. C.A. provides a payback trip to Louisiana for Tampa Bay fly guide Capt. Bryon Chamberlin

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail
programme.desc: A Giant 200" whitetail and two friends hunting him miles apart. The time is ticking for one to find success.

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail
programme.desc: A new outfitting area added to Canadian Whitetail Outfitters and a new set of clients headed to Saskatchewan looking for their dream hunt. A summers scouting and a teams set up hopes to be enough to exceed expectations.

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: Massive wildfires had consumed thousands of acres across the Bighorn Mountains and the neighboring foothills. Would the annual HuntStand pronghorn camp be a total bust, or would the crew be able to find a few animals beyond the smoke?

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jacob Pentecost and Easton Thompson head to Illinois for the youth hunting season. With hot weather and slow deer movement, the hunt proves to be a challenge. After days of patience and persistence, Jacob finally gets the opportunity to fill his tag!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike and Jacob are hunting an old turkey "Meanie" they have some history with on public land. Mike demos the WoodHaven box call clip.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: After starting turkey season off on the road, it's time for us to come back home to Pennsylvania and hunt some turkeys on our home turf! Also joining us this week are our good friends from The Grind Outdoors who come in to hunt some long beards with us.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela joins a well-known outfitter in Spain to pursue an iconic species - the ibex. Along the way, he learns about the rich Spanish hunting tradition, the care with which the practice is managed and the conservation-minded ethos of the country.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green heads to Yankton, South Dakota to learn about the history of the Missouri river and the people who count on the river for sustenance. The invasive carp are set to destroy this rich ecosystem and Kyle aims to stop this fish with his best weapon, a great recipe.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff hear about the dangers of fishing for Bluefin Tuna in the Atlantic Ocean from locals in Gloucester, Massachusetts. Then they head 30 miles out onto the open ocean with Darrin of Reel Respect Charters in the hopes of landing their own giant.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff get bit by catfish in Southern Oklahoma with YouTuber Nate Williams of Adrenaline Rush Adventures while using the most primitive fishing tactic - hand fishing. Learn from the Chickasaw Nation about the history of this method that has been used by Native Americans for thousands of years.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: While releasing a defeated tarpon healthy after an epic battle is the ultimate victory, everything else is measured in heartbreak and degrees of failure. For Justin, putting Ethan on his first silver king requires patience and a tasty diversion by a local chef.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith learns the value of the Trash Can Slam on a flounder trip withCapt. Justin that turns into a multi-species challenge.”

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin Leake and Meredith McCord divert attention from what’s not happening with the tarpon bite to using CoastMaster, light tackle and experience to find snapper success on heavily fished public spots.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor use Lowrance Active Target all day to find fish, first targeting bridge tarpon then finding a variety of species in Florida Bay mullet muds.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Brandon Vargas, as they continue from an earlier flurry of offshore permit catches to a variety of fun offshore targets.

programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head to the Everglades for whatever may come, and that turns out to be some exciting action near the mangroves with snook and baby tarpon.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We join Denny McMahan on this episode at the legendary Thumbtack Ranch in South Texas. Denny was nominated by his wife for Bucks for the Brave program hosted by Trinity Oaks. After dedicating his life to service in the US Army and law enforcement, he now continues the mission by teaching at the police academy. Denny is a true hero in his community - someone who sacrifices his time, his well being, and his life in service to others, never asking for anything in return.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt sits down with Auburn University professor Dr. Steve Ditchkoff to tackle one of the most debated topics in deer management: cull bucks. Is there real science behind the idea of removing “inferior” bucks to improve herd genetics, or is it more myth than management?

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Batter Batter Swing………. Well, you might see where this might be headed. But, Hey!! Slade is in the great state of Kansas. Its mid-October and hes looking to bring home Lori some extra home décor.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: It's a family filled episode as Brandon Simmons goes offshore with his Cousin to find Cobia and Tuna while also bringing his family to his childhood home

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon gets back to his roots and explores the waterways around Cape Canaveral in his Pelican Kayak with his old Fishing buddy, Tyler Hendrix

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: How do you catch a persnickety Redfish? One bite at a time.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: C.A. heads to Apalachicola for a mixed bag of redfish and fresh oyster.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Returning to Venice, Louisiana for the first time in nearly a decade, Rush reconnects with longtime friends Eric and Monique Newman of Journey South Outfitters for an unforgettable inshore fishing adventure in the heart of the Mississippi River Delta. With reports of massive schools of redfish cruising the beaches, Monique (“Moe”) must decide whether to trust the intel and make a bold run down the coast—or rely on her own instincts built from years on the water. The mission is simple: put Rush on a true bull redfish and see if he has what it takes to earn a spot in her coveted “Over 40-Inch Club.” This trip highlights why Venice, Louisiana is considered one of the premier inshore fisheries in the country—and why having the right guide makes all the difference. Target Species: Bull Redfish. Location: Venice, Louisiana – Mississippi Delta. Outfitter: Journey South Outfitters.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: For Ali and Rush, one of the best aspects of fishing is being able to share experiences on the water with interesting people. On this episode we invite luxury watch enthusiast Eric Rivera - AKA "Watch Eric" to the Florida Keys to target Permit and Amberjack in the Gulf.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Jared's teams up with long time friend and fellow guide, Capt. Greg Dini, to conquer the patch reef.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: The tide is right for Capt. Jonathan Moss to chase that Northeast Florida slam.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Tyler and Sara head to Walker, MN in search of late ice bluegills out of Trapper's Landing Lodge.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: The SJTV crew head to famous Lake Vermilion in Northern Minnesota to chase after the fabled Muskies at Everett Bay Lodge!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: We kick off Season 2 in Tennessee where we stop in Nashville, Townsend, and Johnson City!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger break in their new Invincible Catamaran with a trip to fish out of Palm Beach with their friend Captain Dave Fields.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger fly kites with Captain Dave Fields for a great day of sailfishing out of Sailfish Marina in Palm Beach.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger take a long run out into the Gulf from Key West to sample the bottom fishing and the long range capability of their new Invincible Catamaran.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger continue fishing after taking a long run out into the Gulf from Key West to sample the bottom fishing and the long range capability of their new Invincible Catamaran.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: YOU WON'T BELIEVE WHAT THESE FISH DO!! Dr. Mike Larkin is back! Join us for another exciting dive into the mysterious world of fish and learn some of the most shocking fish facts mother nature has to offer.This week, Dr. Larkin takes us on another exploration of the ocean's hidden wonders, unraveling fascinating insights into fish biology. From species that change gender to surprising revelations about their arterial systems, Dr. Larkin's expertise continues to shed light on these underwater marvels.For those who've followed Dr. Larkin's previous appearances, you already know how much you will get from this interview. And if you're new here, welcome aboard for an underwater adventure that will change the way you think about our finned friends.Don't forget to like, subscribe, and share this mind-blowing episode with fellow fish enthusiasts. Let's plunge into the depths of knowledge together!

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: From fuzzy velvet to hardened bone, antlers are more than headgear—they're nature’s calendar. In this episode of Deer & Deer Hunting, we explore the fascinating stages of whitetail antler development, what they reveal about a buck’s age and health, and how understanding this process can help you become a better hunter. Join us as we break down the biology, bust myths, and show real examples from the field.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Can the everyday landowner really manage their property well enough to hold and retain mature bucks year after year? From habitat improvements and food plots to pressure control and property layout, discover what truly influences a buck’s decision to stay—or stray.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: In this in-depth episode of Deer & Deer Hunting TV, the team explores what it truly takes to implement an advanced food plot strategy. We go beyond the basics, walking viewers through soil science, crop rotation, plot placement, and how to integrate food plots into a larger habitat management plan.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Whether you're hunting 10 acres or 1,000, how you handle boundaries, buck movement, and communication with neighboring hunters can make or break your season. The team shares real-world scenarios and proven strategies to foster cooperation, avoid conflict, and build relationships that lead to better deer hunting for everyone.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Everyone knows Colorado for its epic mountains and fresh powder. But on this episode of DIRT, we’re digging into the unexpected side of the state (UFO rumors and all). Whether surfing infinite river waves, cultivating perfect carrot seeds, or fly fishing in downtown Denver’s shadow—geeky passions run high. Follow along as we gather ingredients for a farm to table final feast equal parts foraged, free-range, and free-thinking.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: They say you come to New Zealand as a stranger, but leave as family. In this episode of DIRT, the crew goes full circle—meeting Muttonbird chefs Emma and George on the South Island before hopping up to Raglan and working their way back down. Water skiing next to snow-capped mountains, cooking in hot springs the Māori way, and stargazing at Wairarapa Dark Sky Reserve are all on the itinerary. But it’s the final “Feed” done Kiwi-style that makes one thing clear—in this unique and stunning land, nobody’s a stranger for long.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: Meet Luke DiTella—once a pro surfer, now the founder of Frank August whiskey, and an all-around Renaissance man. Whether it's barrels at a Jersey beach break or barrels of aged whiskey, Luke knows how to turn life into an art form. In this episode of Huckberry Homes, we take a deep dive into Luke’s world at his coastal haven in Monmouth Beach, New Jersey. It’s a place where the salty sea air meets the rich aroma of aged whiskey—a home that’s as rugged yet refined as the man himself. Luke opens his doors to share tales of surfing glory, entrepreneurial grit, and the beautiful chaos of fatherhood (spoiler: they don't care about your design aesthetic).

programme.title: Ike : Countdown to D-Day

programme.title: His Girl Friday
programme.desc: A crafty editor for the Morning Post news uses every trick in the book to keep his fast-talking, ace reporter ex-wife from remarrying her new beau

programme.title: On the Waterfront
programme.desc: A prizefighter-turned-longshoreman with a conscience goes up against labor leaders to expose corruption, extortion and murder among the union ranks.

programme.title: The Undercover Man
programme.desc: Determined Treasury Department investigator Frank Warren (Glenn Ford) goes after a ruthless mobster known as The Big Fellow. When a key informant is murdered, Warren pursues the gangster on charges of tax evasion. But, with a slick mob lawyer hampering him at every turn, and threats being lobbed toward Warren's wife (Nina Foch), the lawman's chances of achieving a conviction are slim to none. His only hope is that one syndicate bookkeeper will have the courage to turn state's evidence.

programme.title: No Sad Songs for Me
programme.desc: Upon being diagnosed with terminal cancer, selfless suburban housewife Mary Scott (Margaret Sullavan) makes the ultimate sacrifice: she decides to keep the unpleasant news from her husband, Brad (Wendell Corey), and daughter, Polly, to avoid devastating her loved ones. Instead, Mary encourages Brad's affair with a co-worker (Viveca Lindfors), and even grooms the other woman to take her place. But as Mary's illness progresses, keeping it a secret presents a considerable challenge.

programme.title: The Devil at 4 O'Clock
programme.desc: After a volcano erupts on a South Sea island, a fallen priest and three convicts race to save the lives of children in a mountaintop leper colony.

programme.title: You Belong to Me
programme.desc: Rich playboy Peter Kirk (Henry Fonda) crashes into Dr. Helen Hunt (Barbara Stanwyck) on a ski slope and overplays his injuries so she will continue her medical attention. He declares his love, and, although Helen insists that her career will always come first, the two get married. Soon, Peter is consumed by jealous suspicions of his wife's male patients and embarrasses Helen several times. Fearful of driving her away, Peter launches into character-changing behavior to prove his love.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: This steamy pot-boiler follows the intrigues surrounding an escaped convict who attempts to return to the small southern town where he grew up.

programme.title: It Should Happen to You
programme.desc: A young model finds her dreams of fame coming true when she rents billboards in New York to advertise herself, attracting fans and two rival suitors.

programme.title: Cactus Flower
programme.desc: A dentist pretends he's married to avoid committing to his girlfriend. When she asks to meet his wife, he enlists his nurse to pose as his spouse.

programme.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
programme.desc: A youth leader and idealist fights false accusations and corruption from the political machine that engineered his appointment to the U.S. Senate.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: The Caine Mutiny
programme.desc: During World War II, a dilapidated vessel, the Caine, gets a new ensign, Willis Keith (Robert Francis), and a new captain, Commander Queeg (Humphrey Bogart). The crew sees Queeg's unconventional behavior as irrational, and communications officer Thomas Keefer (Fred MacMurray) spreads suspicion about his suitability as captain. When a dire situation during a storm forces the executive officer (Van Johnson) to relieve Queeg of his duties, he and Ensign Keith are tried for mutiny.

programme.title: The Doctor Takes a Wife
programme.desc: A writer (Loretta Young) and a neurologist (Ray Milland) accept rumors of their marriage when each stands to gain from the mistake.

programme.title: We Were Strangers
programme.desc: When her brother is murdered, China Valdez (Jennifer Jones) swears revenge on the corrupt Cuban government he had been protesting. She joins the resistance led by Tony (John Garfield), an American with a plan that promises devastating results to their enemies. First they'll kill a government official, then plant a bomb at the funeral, which will wipe out the dead man's associates when it explodes. All they need to do is to dig an underground tunnel from China's house to the cemetery next door.

programme.title: Ten Cents a Dance
programme.desc: Barbara O'Neill (Barbara Stanwyck) is a poor dance hall girl who catches the eye of the wealthy Bradley Carlton (Ricardo Cortez). However, Barbara has feelings for her neighbor Eddie Miller (Monroe Owsley). After Eddie proposes to her, she says yes, and even secures a job for him from Bradley. Soon, though, Eddie has racked up deep gambling debts and even been unfaithful. Barbara continues to support him, but after he lashes out in jealousy she thinks maybe she should have chosen Bradley.

programme.title: The Long Gray Line
programme.desc: An Irish immigrant who found a home in the Army as a West Point instructor becomes very close to his pupils, one of whom is Dwight Eisenhower.

programme.title: 5 Against the House
programme.desc: At Harold's Club in Reno, what begins as a joke for four college friends ends as a reality, when a heist goes ahead with disastrous results.

programme.title: Born Free
programme.desc: An English couple in Kenya raises an orphaned lion cub to adulthood. When a warden demands she be sent to a zoo, they train her to live in the wild.

programme.title: All the King's Men
programme.desc: This Academy Award winner for Best Picture tells the story of an idealistic Southern politician brought down by his own ambition and lust for power.

programme.title: Berserk
programme.desc: Suspicions fall on the imperious ringmistress of a traveling circus when she appears unfazed by a series of mysterious and grisly murders.

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: A stranded group of six Allied soldiers trek across the desert, making their way to an abandoned fort, but are soon faced with a German battalion.

programme.title: The Guns of Navarone
programme.desc: Based on the book by Alistair MacLean.

programme.title: Apache Territory
programme.desc: A drifter crossing the Arizona desert routs a band of marauding Apaches and rescues the young survivor of a massacre.

programme.title: Decision at Sundown
programme.desc: Bart and sidekick Sam arrive in Sundown on the wedding day of town boss Tate Kimbrough, whom Bart blames for his wife's death years earlier.

programme.title: Saddles and Sagebrush
programme.desc: A rancher (Russell Hayden) joins an outlaw gang to figure out how to stop it.

programme.title: Traveling Saleswoman
programme.desc: A soapmaker's daughter (Joan Davis) goes to the Wild West, followed by her boyfriend (Andy Devine).

programme.title: Land Raiders
programme.desc: An Arizona land-grabber (Telly Savalas) and his brother (George Maharis) renew their feud amid Army troops and Apaches.

programme.title: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Jed Cooper (Victor Mature), a trapper, enlists as an army fort scout, and shortly after meets and falls for Corinna Marston (Anne Bancroft), the wife of a nearby fort's commander. Jed comes across her husband, Col. Marston (Robert Preston), after he's suffered an attack at the hands of Native Americans. Col. Marston forces the captain of Jed's fort, Glenn Riordan (Guy Madison), to send out Jed and the troops to fight his attackers, despite their lack of battle experience.

programme.title: The Hawk of Wild River
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) has himself thrown in jail to trick an outlaw known as the Hawk (Clayton Moore) and bring him and his entire gang to justice.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four soldiers of fortune are hired by a wealthy rancher to rescue his beautiful young wife who has been kidnapped by a villainous Mexican bandit. When they finally find her, after fighting their way across deserts and mountains, they discover she is not being held against her will. This causes friction within the band as to whether they should honor their agreement.

programme.title: Return to Warbow
programme.desc: Three escaped convicts return to collect the money that the brother of one of them has already spent.

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: The conniving Ed Barker (Dick Curtis) murders a rancher and tries to steal the ranch from his widow, Jean Andrews (Ann Doran). However, their old friend Cliff Houston (Charles Starrett) appears on the scene to try and save the day. He makes a deal with Barker and his crew to drive the Andrews herd to market and split the money, but each man really plans to con the other as soon as the time is right. Along for the ride is singing cowboy Bob Stevens (Bob Nolan).

programme.title: The Rough, Tough West
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) looks for his friend Big Jack (Jack Mahoney) and finds out that Jack is illegally commandeering the mines and claims of others.

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: Three brothers become outlaws after the Civil War, while a fourth sibling goes to work for the railroad.

programme.title: The Black Dakotas
programme.desc: A Confederate plot to turn the Sioux against the Union crumbles when a double agent makes off with a shipment of gold.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: Dan Evans (Van Heflin), a drought-plagued Arizona rancher, volunteers to take captured stagecoach robber and murderer Ben Wade (Glenn Ford) from Bisbee to Contention City, where the criminal will be put aboard the 3:10 train to Yuma for his trial. Accompanied only by the town drunk, Alex Potter (Henry Jones), Dan battles Wade's henchman (Richard Jaeckel), the murder victim's revenge-minded brother, and the temptation of the large bribe Wade offers in exchange for his freedom.

programme.title: Battle of Rogue River
programme.desc: A cavalry major (George Montgomery) makes peace with Indians despite an agitator (Richard Denning) working for carpetbaggers.

programme.title: A Man Called Sledge
programme.desc: In the Old West, a gunfighting outlaw connives his way into a jail with the goal of stealing a large shipment of gold stored in the prison.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) tries to stop an Army scout and a band of outlaws from starting an American Indian war.

programme.title: A Tornado in the Saddle
programme.desc: Ranchers and a new sheriff (Russell Hayden) have trouble with a gold rush.

programme.title: Streets of Ghost Town
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) and his sidekick (Smiley Burnette) look for stolen gold with a history.

programme.title: Secret of Treasure Mountain
programme.desc: An Apache curse hangs over good guys (Valerie French, William Prince) and a villain (Raymond Burr) seeking Spanish gold.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: Rancher Lee Hackett (Van Heflin) spends so much time trying to keep the violent streak of his son Ed (Tab Hunter) in check, he neglects the needs of his other son Davy (James Darren). When Ed's temper results in the death of an innocent Native American, Lee tries his best to cover his son's tracks by making a deal with unscrupulous horse trader Jensen (Ray Teal), who falsely testifies on Ed's behalf. But it becomes clear that Ed can't change, and a shootout between father and son ensues.

programme.title: Saddles and Sagebrush
programme.desc: A rancher (Russell Hayden) joins an outlaw gang to figure out how to stop it.

programme.title: Traveling Saleswoman
programme.desc: A soapmaker's daughter (Joan Davis) goes to the Wild West, followed by her boyfriend (Andy Devine).

programme.desc: An Arizona land-grabber (Telly Savalas) and his brother (George Maharis) renew their feud amid Army troops and Apaches.

programme.title: The Last Frontier

Jed comes across her husband, Col. Marston (Robert Preston), after he's suffered an attack at the hands of Native Americans. Col. Marston forces the captain of Jed's fort, Glenn Riordan (Guy Madison), to send out Jed and the troops to fight his attackers, despite their lack of battle experience.

programme.title: The Hawk of Wild River
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) has himself thrown in jail to trick an outlaw known as the Hawk (Clayton Moore) and bring him and his entire gang to justice.

programme.title: The Longest Drive
programme.desc: After a decade apart, a pair of brothers reunites to find their long-lost sister, who was kidnapped as a child and is now living with a native tribe.

programme.title: Buck and the Preacher
programme.desc: A trail guide who protects former slaves and a con-man join forces against bounty hunters hired to drive the former slaves back into the south.

programme.title: Juarez
programme.desc: The true story of Mexico's Abe Lincoln and his fight against the French.

programme.title: The Belle of New York
programme.desc: A turn-of-the-century playboy courts a Salvation Army girl.

programme.title: The Charge of the Light Brigade
programme.desc: Two brothers love the same woman at a perilous Indian outpost.

programme.desc: A pair of feuding co-workers at a music shop in turn-of-the-century Chicago have no idea they are falling in love as anonymous romantic pen pals.

programme.title: Battle of the Bulge

programme.desc: After finding his missing friend undead in Dracula’s crypt, vampire hunter Van Helsing must save his pal’s frail fiancée from the count’s next bite.

programme.desc: Brennan's father (Ryan O'Neal) invites a distant relative, Margaret Whitesell (Zooey Deschanel), to spend Christmas with him and his daughter; Brennan and Booth investigate when a man dressed as Santa Claus is blown up after a botched bank robbery.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth travel to Mexico to investigate human remains with extraterrestrial attributes; Angela and intern Wendell come clean about their relationship.

programme.desc: A retired SEAL -- who tracked people impersonating military personnel -- is murdered; Brody finds that LaSalle is uncharacteristically unenthusiastic about Christmas.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
